      • nanoStream

        public nanoStream(boolean HAVE_VIDEO,
          nanoStream.VideoSourceType videoSource,
          int VIDEO_WIDTH,
          int VIDEO_HEIGHT,
          int VIDEO_BITRATE,
          int VIDEO_FRAMERATE,
          int VIDEO_KEYFRAME_INTERVAL,
          boolean VIDEO_USE_AUTOFOCUS,
          boolean VIDEO_USE_TORCH,
          boolean VIDEO_CROP,
          SurfaceHolder PREVIEW_HOLDER,
          boolean HAVE_AUDIO,
          int AUDIO_CHANNELS,
          int AUDIO_BITRATE,
          int AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATE,
          java.lang.String LICENSE,
          java.lang.String STREAM_URL,
          java.lang.String STREAM_NAME,
          java.lang.String AUTH_USER,
          java.lang.String AUTH_PASSWORD,
          NanostreamEventListener EVENT_LISTENER,
          AdaptiveBitrateControlSettings ABC_SETTINGS)
           throws NanostreamException
        Creates a new instance of nanoStream.
        Parameters:
        HAVE_VIDEO - Whether the stream contains a video channel.
        USE_FRONT_CAMERA - Which camera should be used: front or back.
        VIDEO_WIDTH - The video width in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_HEIGHT - The video height in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_BITRATE - The video encoding bitrate. [bit/s]
        VIDEO_FRAMERATE - The video framerate. [fps]
        VIDEO_KEYFRAME_INTERVAL - Time between two I-Frames. [s]
        VIDEO_USE_AUTOFOCUS - Enable autofocus for the used camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_USE_TORCH - Enable the torch of the used camera (usually only available for the back camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_CROP - Wether 4:3 images should be cropped to 16:9
        PREVIEW_HOLDER - The holder of the surface for the preview.
        HAVE_AUDIO - Whether the stream contains a audio channel.
        AUDIO_CHANNELS - The number of used audio channels [1 or 2]
        AUDIO_BITRATE - The audio encoding bitrate. [bit/s] [Not implemented yet.]
        AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATE - The audio samplerate. [Hz] [Not implemented yet.]
        LICENSE - License for using streaming library.
        STREAM_URL - The URL of the streaming server (e.g. "rtmp://localhost/live").
        STREAM_NAME - The name of the stream (e.g "myStream").
        AUTH_USER - Username for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        AUTH_PASSWORD - Password for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        EVENT_LISTENER - Listener/Observer for NanostreamEvent(s)
        ABC_SETTINGS -
        Throws:
        NanostreamException

          java.lang.String AUTH_PASSWORD,
          NanostreamEventListener EVENT_LISTENER,
          AdaptiveBitrateControlSettings ABC_SETTINGS,
          Logging.LogSettings LOG_SETTINGS)
           throws NanostreamException
        Creates a new instance of nanoStream.
        Parameters:
        HAVE_VIDEO - Whether the stream contains a video channel.
        USE_FRONT_CAMERA - Which camera should be used: front or back.
        VIDEO_WIDTH - The video width in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_HEIGHT - The video height in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_BITRATE - The video encoding bitrate. [bit/s]
        VIDEO_FRAMERATE - The video framerate. [fps]
        VIDEO_KEYFRAME_INTERVAL - Time between two I-Frames. [s]
        VIDEO_USE_AUTOFOCUS - Enable autofocus for the used camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_USE_TORCH - Enable the torch of the used camera (usually only available for the back camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_CROP - Wether 4:3 images should be cropped to 16:9
        PREVIEW_HOLDER - The holder of the surface for the preview.
        HAVE_AUDIO - Whether the stream contains a audio channel.
        AUDIO_CHANNELS - The number of used audio channels [1 or 2]
        AUDIO_BITRATE - The audio encoding bitrate. [bit/s] [Not implemented yet.]
        AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATE - The audio samplerate. [Hz] [Not implemented yet.]
        LICENSE - License for using streaming library.
        STREAM_URL - The URL of the streaming server (e.g. "rtmp://localhost/live").
        STREAM_NAME - The name of the stream (e.g "myStream").
        AUTH_USER - Username for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        AUTH_PASSWORD - Password for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        EVENT_LISTENER - Listener/Observer for NanostreamEvent(s)
        ABC_SETTINGS - Settings for Adaptive Bitrate Control
        LOG_SETTINGS - Settings for Logging in the nanoStream framework including the native library.
        Throws:
        NanostreamException

        public nanoStream(boolean HAVE_VIDEO,
          nanoStream.VideoSourceType videoSource,
          int VIDEO_WIDTH,
          int VIDEO_HEIGHT,
          int VIDEO_BITRATE,
          int VIDEO_FRAMERATE,
          int VIDEO_KEYFRAME_INTERVAL,
          boolean VIDEO_USE_AUTOFOCUS,
          boolean VIDEO_USE_TORCH,
          boolean VIDEO_CROP,
          SurfaceHolder PREVIEW_HOLDER,
          boolean HAVE_AUDIO,
          int AUDIO_CHANNELS,
          int AUDIO_BITRATE,
          int AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATE,
          java.lang.String LICENSE,
          java.lang.String STREAM_URL,
          java.lang.String STREAM_NAME,
          java.lang.String AUTH_USER,
          java.lang.String AUTH_PASSWORD,
          NanostreamEventListener EVENT_LISTENER,
          AdaptiveBitrateControlSettings ABC_SETTINGS,
          Logging.LogSettings LOG_SETTINGS,
          boolean SEND_RTMP,
          boolean BACKUP_MP4,
          java.lang.String MP4_BACKUP_PATH)
           throws NanostreamException
        Creates a new instance of nanoStream.
        Parameters:
        HAVE_VIDEO - Whether the stream contains a video channel.
        USE_FRONT_CAMERA - Which camera should be used: front or back.
        VIDEO_WIDTH - The video width in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_HEIGHT - The video height in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_BITRATE - The video encoding bitrate. [bit/s]
        VIDEO_FRAMERATE - The video framerate. [fps]
        VIDEO_KEYFRAME_INTERVAL - Time between two I-Frames. [s]
        VIDEO_USE_AUTOFOCUS - Enable autofocus for the used camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_USE_TORCH - Enable the torch of the used camera (usually only available for the back camera. [Not implemented yet.]
        VIDEO_CROP - Wether 4:3 images should be cropped to 16:9
        PREVIEW_HOLDER - The holder of the surface for the preview.
        HAVE_AUDIO - Whether the stream contains a audio channel.
        AUDIO_CHANNELS - The number of used audio channels [1 or 2]
        AUDIO_BITRATE - The audio encoding bitrate. [bit/s] [Not implemented yet.]
        AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATE - The audio samplerate. [Hz] [Not implemented yet.]
        LICENSE - License for using streaming library.
        STREAM_URL - The URL of the streaming server (e.g. "rtmp://localhost/live").
        STREAM_NAME - The name of the stream (e.g "myStream").
        AUTH_USER - Username for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        AUTH_PASSWORD - Password for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        EVENT_LISTENER - Listener/Observer for NanostreamEvent(s)
        ABC_SETTINGS - Settings for Adaptive Bitrate Control
        LOG_SETTINGS - Settings for Logging in the nanoStream framework including the native library.
        SEND_RTMP - Flag to toggle rtmp on/off
        BACKUP_MP4 - Flag to toggle mp4 Backup on/off.
        MP4_BACKUP_PATH - Path for the mp4 backup.
        ENABLE_AUDIO_ABC - Enable Adaptive Bitrate Controll for Audio (true | false)
        Throws:
        NanostreamException

        public nanoStream(nanoStream.VideoSourceType videoSource,
          int VIDEO_WIDTH,
          int VIDEO_HEIGHT,
          int VIDEO_BIT_RATE,
          int VIDEO_FRAME_RATE,
          SurfaceHolder PREVIEW_HOLDER,
          int AUDIO_CHANNELS,
          java.lang.String LICENSE,
          java.lang.String STREAM_URL,
          java.lang.String STREAM_NAME,
          java.lang.String AUTH_USER,
          java.lang.String AUTH_PASSWORD,
          NanostreamEventListener EVENT_LISTENER,
          AdaptiveBitrateControlSettings ABC_SETTINGS,
          Logging.LogSettings LOG_SETTINGS)
           throws NanostreamException
        Creates a new instance of nanoStream.
        Parameters:
        USE_FRONT_CAMERA - Which camera should be used: front or back.
        VIDEO_WIDTH - The video width in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_HEIGHT - The video height in pixel. [px]
        VIDEO_BIT_RATE - The video encoding bitrate. [bit/s]
        VIDEO_FRAME_RATE - The video framerate. [fps]
        PREVIEW_HOLDER - The holder of the surface for the preview.
        AUDIO_CHANNELS - The number of used audio channels [1 or 2]
        LICENSE - License for using streaming library.
        STREAM_URL - The URL of the streaming server (e.g. "rtmp://localhost/live").
        STREAM_NAME - The name of the stream (e.g "myStream").
        AUTH_USER - Username for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        AUTH_PASSWORD - Password for authentication. [Not implemented yet.]
        EVENT_LISTENER - Listener/Observer for NanostreamEvent(s)
        ABC_SETTINGS - Settings for Adaptive Bitrate Control
        LOG_SETTINGS - Settings for Logging in the nanoStream framework including the native library.
        Throws:
        NanostreamException

      • setFocusArea

        public void setFocusArea(int focusWidth,
                int focusHeight,
                float areaMultiple,
                int x,
                int y,
                int previewWidth,
                int previewHeight,
                int weight)
        set Focus Area
        Parameters:
        focusWidth - the focus Area width
        focusHeight - the focus Area height
        areaMultiple - a Multiple for the focus area (default: 1f)
        x - the x position on the Screen
        y - the y position on the Screen
        previewWidth - the width of the preview
        previewHeight - the height of the preview
        weight - the weight of the area must be range from 1 to 1000 check isFocusSupported() first.

      • setCameraRotation

        public boolean setCameraRotation(nanoStream.Rotation rotation)
        Set the camera rotation
        Parameters:
        Rotation - 0, 180 90, 270 not supported yet.
        Returns:
        true if Rotation value is supported | false if Rotation value is unsupported

      • isOnTheFlyCameraSwitchingAllowed

        public boolean isOnTheFlyCameraSwitchingAllowed()
        Check if the resolution is allowed for on the fly camera switching. nanoStream.VideoSourceType need to be nanoStream.VideoSourceType.INTERNAL_BACK or nanoStream.VideoSourceType.INTERNAL_FRONT
        Parameters:
        r - Resolution
        Returns:
        true | false
